Upper & Lower Case First Letters Make Same Subs
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance Archive (GameBoy Advance): Shrine Topics: Upper & Lower Case First Letters Make Same Subs
By Lisa Shock on Sunday, December 2, 2001 - 05:24 pm:

So far, in my admitted limited tests, when I use a word in the shine, then alter the first letter to be upper or lower case with no ther changes, the two monsters created have the same sub-breed.
Example:
Fire = Rock Zuum
fire = Zaza

The one exception seems to be that if a pure-breed is made, then both will be pures, rather than the sub being the same.
Example:
Ice = Pure Zuum
ice = Pure Golem

And, if you simply change the first letter on a word as few as 3 letters, you can get the same sub.
Here's a list of some working tricks. "-" is for a blank where you can place whatever letter you like.

-ord = Joker sub
-or = Durahan sub
-ar = all the pure types

By BlueBomber on Sunday, December 2, 2001 - 06:40 pm:

cool.nice sluthing!!!very observant. I never noticed!

By John Hawley on Saturday, December 8, 2001 - 08:16 am:

I've also noticed that not only are subs the same, but characteristics are the same or similar and stats also have a pattern.

For example, using Celebre gives a Sodacchi (Mocchi/Psiroller) with Soft Body (damage reducer), Earth Know and Grace Step; stats 85,111,138,138,126,116.

In lowercase, celebre makes a Sabani (Arrowhead/Psiroller) with Hard Shell (damage reducer), Earth Know and Grace Step; stats are 105,106,93,93,166,86.

The really weird part is each monster's Spd and Acc are tied.

A For-What-Its-Worth post.
